Directions: Base your answer to the following questions on the information below and on your knowledge of science.
Title: Carbohydrates and Proteins
Content: Carbohydrates are nutrients that are broken down into simple sugars in the human body. These sugars are carried by the blood to all of the body cells. The cells release energy when the simple sugars are broken down further during the process of cellular respiration. Proteins are nutrients that are broken down by the body into amino acids. Amino acids are important molecules for creating new cells and making other compounds for life processes.
